article_title: NBC-2.com WBBH News for Fort Myers, Cape Coral & Naples, Florida
article_text:
Fort Myers Police arrested the suspect involved in the robbery of the Wells Fargo Bank.

According to police, Richard Heins, 27, was arrested on Saturday at 10:13 p.m. He is accused of robbing a Fort Myers Wells Fargo bank on Friday.

Heins was identified as a suspect late Friday night. An anonymous tip Saturday evening helped investigators find Heins in North Fort Myers.

With the assistance of Lee County Sheriff’s deputies, Heins was spotted in a taxi going into the city.

Officers conducted a traffic stop and took Heins into custody. He was charged with one count of robbery.
